attributes.comment:
I am expressing my extreme displeasure with the proposed 66% fee increase for
filing paperwork for international adoptions. This makes the 2nd increase in two
years and unfairly places a greater burden on adoptive parents.

This proposal for increases claims that with the extra money received the USCIS
will decrease wait times 20% by 2009 for 4 documents, none of which apply to
international adoptions. Why then, does the CIS propose to make those seeking
to adopt internationally pay for these improvements when it does not aid or help in
reducing the wait time for international adoption paperwork?

This proposed increase unfairly targets adoptive families who will receive no
benefit. As it stands now, those of us adopting from China will have file our I-600a
twice and get re-fingerprinted, already a waste of money since we have been
through the process once. CIS should propose the second filing be eliminated as
it would reduce repetitive paperwork. Instead, they are proposing that we pay more
for something that we have already received and been approved for.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Shannon Chambers
